description:
On March 27, 2020, the government said it would suspend all visa exemption policies and issuance of tourist visas, e-visas and visas on arrival to all foreigners from 23:59 (local time), Monday, March 30 for a period of at least one month, taking us to April 30 at the earliest.
These requirements do not apply for foreigners holding a diplomatic visa (Visa A) or official visa (Visa B).

description: The Ministry of Education, Youth and Sports has announced the reopening of some public and private schools from grades 9 to 12 across the country starting from September 7, but only in four low-risk provinces such as Kratie, Stung Treng, Ratanakkiri, and Mondulkiri town.

description: The Ministry of Education on October 27, 2020 announced the third phase of school reopenings, which will see all students in the country going back to classes with preventive guidelines and a modified curriculum from November 2 onwards after months of closures to prevent the spread of COVID-19.
